attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent, I believe that the large increase in these fees are prohibitive
for other parents considering adoption. When a family decides to adopt
internationally, they are already looking at much larger expenses. Considering
that only 1% of international orphans are adopted, why would you want to
increase the fees and possibly discourage other families from adopting these
orphans? Although these increases may seem small in "government terms", to a
family saving every penny to be able to afford to adopt, this may be the fee that
literally breaks the bank. I am sure there are other, more creative, ways to
achieve the same financial goals.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Mary Correa
